titles.title: Hast Thou Heard Him Seen Him (no chorus in book)

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1 v7 c1

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
G
Hast thou heard Him,
Seen Him, known Him?
Is not thine a captured heart?
Chief among ten thousand own Him,
Joyful choose the better part.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines:
Thou art the fairest of thousands to me
Seize Thou my heart
Cause my blind eyes to see
Crushing all idols
With joy I crown Thee
As the fairest of thousands to me

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Idols once they won thee
Charmed thee,
Lovely things of time and sense;
Gilded thus does sin disarm thee,
Honeyed lest thou turn thee thence.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
What has stripped
The seeming beauty
From the idols of the earth?
Not a sense of right or duty,
But the sight of peerless worth

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Not the crushing of those idols,
With its bitter void and smart,
But the beaming of His beauty,
The unveiling of His heart.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
Who extinguishes their taper
Till they hail the rising sun?
Who discards the garb of winter
Till the summer has begun?

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
'Tis that look that melted Peter
'Tis that face that Stephen saw,
'Tis that heart that wept with Mary,
Can alone from idols draw.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines:
Draw and win and fill completely
Till the cup o'erflow the brim;
What have we to do with idols
Who have companied with Him?,
